titles.title: To honor the United States astronauts who flew in space as part of the program of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to reach and explore the Moon.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Science, Space and Technology.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Space.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Mr. Hall (TX) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Considered under suspension of the rules.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Science, Space and Technology

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/24/1994--Introduced. Declares that specified U.S. astronauts who flew in space as part of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration program to reach and explore the moon shall carry the honorary title Space Emissary and shall be referred to as "The Honorable."
